comments.author: KellyHands
comments.body: Since it's impossible to delete an account from the platform once created. Is it possible for a username to be used more than ones, probably because the previous ones are not active over a long period of time?

comments.author: witcher_sense
comments.body: Quote from: KellyHands on August 05, 2022, 04:14:10 AMSince it's impossible to delete an account from the platform once created. Is it possible for a username to be used more than ones, probably because the previous ones are not active over a long period of time?Only administrators can change usernames, but you'll need to provide a good reason why your username should be changed to convince them to do that. Moreover, it's unlikely that an administrator will agree to change the username of an inactive account because the inactive may suddenly become active and rightfully demand to return his username. It might work with permabanned accounts, though.Although you can't delete an account on this forum, you can take the following steps to abandon it: 1. delete all your posts; 2. ask people politely who quoted your posts to delete their posts; 3. ask people politely who maintain archive versions of this forum (LoyceV, TryNinja, ...) to delete everything that mentions you; 4. generate a long random password using a reliable password manager and use it as your account password; never save a copy of it; 5. change your account email to a disposal email; 6. change your email again to a new disposable email; 7. when the confirmation email arrives at your old disposable email, click "lock your account"; 8. forget about your account.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: KellyHands on August 05, 2022, 04:14:10 AMSince it's impossible to delete an account from the platform once created. Is it possible for a username to be used more than ones, probably because the previous ones are not active over a long period of time?No, it is not possible to use the same username more than once, regardless of the inactivity of the previous user. Once a username is registered on the platform, it remains recorded in the database and no one else can use it again. It is possible for the admin to change the username upon request (in rare and justified circumstances), but the old username remains unavailable to prevent misuse.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on August 05, 2022, 03:59:03 AM<…>It wouldn’t really be a technical problem at all, and the reason is more of a conceptual choice than anything else. Historical account UserIds have gaps, meaning that for some reason or other, some accounts were not created or the TX that was to created them rolled-back. These gaps do not cause any issues, and are never reassigned at a later stage if the programming is done correctly.SMF, although does allow for accounts to be deleted, as can be seen here:https://wiki.simplemachines.org/smf/Profile#Delete_This_AccountBitcointalk simply chose not to allow for accounts to be deleted.Note: I cannot state what versions of SMF it applies to, but is would seem like a feature that was there from the initial version.
